```txt
40de36e09942   26MiB contracts/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js.map
ed7ff04efa15   31MiB src/storage/target/debug/deps/libweb3-7deaec3cca9f2587.rlib
```

The only other (not in `node_modules` or `target` directory) file of significance is:

```
7552562c0418a03ef62ffebdfc02474868035e4e, 7.6MiB,src/go/do-manager/do-manager
```

This is only the files > 1MiB, which total size is 824MB uncompressed.

You can reproduce this data with this command:

```bash
git rev-list --objects --all | git cat-file --batch-check='%(objecttype),%(objectname),%(objectsize),%(rest)' | sed -n 's/^blob,//p' | sort -t, --numeric-sort --key=2 | $(command -v gnumfmt || echo numfmt) -d, --field=2 --to=iec-i --suffix=B --padding=7 --round=nearest | grep 'node_modules\|target' > blob_filesizes.csv
```

The current bundle of code is ~360MB, and new bundle would be 2MB in size.

I'm not saying you should blow away your history, but y'all might consider a fresh start some point soon given that this project is only a year old, and your repo has a couple 100 megabytes in bloat that is already meaningless.

It's possible to remove bad commits:
https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Rewriting-History
@flyinprogrammer with zkSync 2.0 this will no longer be an issue.
